page.title: 11Housing - Hittisleigh
page.content: A Victorian school and master's house, as well as a chapel and a farmhouse, are in red brick, providing an unusually great contrast from the cob and thatch. The School is now the Village Hall, and the master's house a private dwelling. At the same time several houses were built in pale orange brick, produced locally at Tilery, now Thornemoor. There are 2 wooden dwellings and 2 residential caravans. All the modern buildings are bungalows, because of planning regulations, requiring them to blend into the landscape.
